001package io.jstach.rainbowgum.pattern.format;
002
003import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties;
004import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.Property;
005
006/**
007 * Builder to create {@link io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig.Provider<io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEncoder> }.
008 * <table class="table">
009 * <caption><strong>Properties retrieved from LogProperties</strong></caption>
010 * <tr>
011 * <th>Property Pattern</th>
012 * <th>Type</th>
013 * <th>Required</th>
014 * <th>Default</th>
015 * <th>Description</th>
016 * </tr>
017 * <tr>
018 * <td><code>{@value PROPERTY_pattern }</code></td>
019 * <td><code>String</code></td>
020 * <td><code>true</code></td>
021 * <td><code>null</code></td>
022 * <td></td>
023 * </tr>
024 * </table>
025 */
026public final class PatternEncoderBuilder {
027
028        /**
029         * The properties to be retrieved from config will have
030         * this prefix.
031         */
032        static final String PROPERTY_PREFIX = "logging.encoder.{name}.";
033        
034        /**
035         * <code>{@value #PROPERTY_pattern } = java.lang.String</code> 
036         */
037        static final String PROPERTY_pattern = PROPERTY_PREFIX + "pattern";
038        
039        private final String propertyPrefix;
040        final Property<java.lang.String> property_pattern;
041        
042        private final java.lang.String name;
043        private java.lang.@org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable String pattern = null;
044        
045        /**
046         * Create a builder for {@code io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig.Provider<io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEncoder> }.
047         * @param name will fill <code>{name}</code> in <code>logging.encoder.{name}.</code>. 
048         */
049        public PatternEncoderBuilder(
050                        java.lang.String name
051                        ) {
052                java.util.Map<String,String> prefixParameters = java.util.Map.of(
053                                "name", name
054                        );
055                this.propertyPrefix = LogProperties.interpolateKey(PROPERTY_PREFIX, prefixParameters);
056                this.name = name;
057                property_pattern = Property.builder()
058                                                .build(LogProperties.interpolateKey(PROPERTY_pattern, prefixParameters));
059
060        }
061
062        
063        /**
064         * Sets <strong>required</strong> pattern.
065         * 
066         * Default is <code>null</code>.
067         * @param pattern <code>{@value #PROPERTY_pattern } = java.lang.String</code> 
068         * @return this builder.
069         */
070        public PatternEncoderBuilder pattern(java.lang.String pattern) {
071                this.pattern = pattern;
072                return this;
073        }
074        
075        /**
076         * Creates {@code io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig.Provider<io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEncoder> } from this builder.
077         * @return {@code io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig.Provider<io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEncoder> }.
078         */
079        public io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig.Provider<io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEncoder> build() {
080                return io.jstach.rainbowgum.pattern.format.PatternEncoderProvider.provide(
081                                this.name
082                                , property_pattern.require(this.pattern)
083                                );
084        }
085        
086        /**
087         * Fills the builder from properties.
088         * @param properties not null.
089         * @return this updated builder.
090         */
091        public PatternEncoderBuilder fromProperties(LogProperties properties) {
092                this.pattern = property_pattern.get(properties).value(this.pattern);
093                return this;
094        }
095        
096        /**
097         * Turns the builder into java.util.Properties like Map skipping values that are null.
098         * @param consumer apply is called where first arg is key and second is value.
099         */
100        public void toProperties(java.util.function.BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) {
101                var _pattern = this.pattern;
102                if (_pattern != null) {
103                        consumer.accept(property_pattern.key(), property_pattern.propertyString(_pattern));
104                }
105        }
106        
107        /**
108         * The interpolated property prefix: {@value #PROPERTY_PREFIX}.
109         * @return resolved prefix which should end with a "<code>.</code>".
110         */
111        public String propertyPrefix() {
112                return this.propertyPrefix;
113        }
114        
115}
